Class GamePage

  • java.lang.Object
    • GamePage

  • class GamePage
extends java.lang.Object
    GamePage is the class used to signify the page the game will be played on. It contains all the components required to make the visual page.
    Author:
    Meet Arora

        static void setPlayers(int numPlayers,
                       Player[] players)
        Sets the variable numPlayers and the Player object array players
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - the number of players selected
        players - the array of Player objects

      • setUndoLabel

        void setUndoLabel(int undo_left)
        Sets the label showing the number of undo moves left for the player that just played their chance.
        Parameters:
        undo_left - is the number of undo moves left for the player that just played their chance

      • makeBoxClickable

        static void makeBoxClickable(int i,
                             int j)
        Makes the cells that are valid for the current player have the 'click' cursor on hover
        Parameters:
        i - the row index of the cell
        j - the column index of the cell

      • makeBoxUnclickable

        static void makeBoxUnclickable(int i,
                               int j)
        Makes the cells that are invalid for the current player have the 'default' cursor on hover
        Parameters:
        i - the row index of the cell
        j - the column index of the cell

      • setFocus

        static void setFocus(int i,
                     int j)
        Gives focus to the cell in the ith row and jth column. Mainly used to signify which cell the computer played on.
        Parameters:
        i - the row index of the cell
        j - the column index of the cell

      • buildGrid

        static void buildGrid(myRectangle[][] box,
                      int n,
                      int m)
        Makes the grid that will be used for the game. The cells are given all the required properties as well as event handlers. Once made, they are added to the gridpane.
        Parameters:
        box - the 2D array of myRectangle type that are used to create the visual grid
        n - the number of rows
        m - the number of columns

      • destroyGrid

        static void destroyGrid()
        Removes the visual grid when changing scenes so that no part of a previous grid remains on resuming or starting a new game.

      • addComboboxEvents

        private void addComboboxEvents(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> comboBox,
                               javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane borderPane,
                               javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Adds the required event handlers for the combobox choices. Also adds fade out effect on the BorderPane.
        Parameters:
        comboBox - the ComboBox whose choices need the appropriate event handlers
        borderPane - the BorderPane to which the fade out effect is added
        stage - the Stage being used on the game page

      • buildButtons

        private void buildButtons(javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane borderPane,
                          javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Builds the UI elements on the game page. Makes the button, combobox, and the label that appears below the grid. Also sets the event handlers for mouse clicks as well as key presses.
        Parameters:
        borderPane - the BorderPane used to align the UI elements
        stage - the Stage being used on the game page

      • changeGridLineColor

        static void changeGridLineColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Changes the colour of the lines of the grid as well the background in accordance with the current player's color.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the current player whose turn it is

      • serialize

        void serialize()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Serializes the state of the Grid object in order to save the current game that's being played.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a generic output error occurs with ObjectOutputStream

      • deserialize

        void deserialize()
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Deserializes the serialised file in order to restore the saved state of the game so that the user can resume the game where they left it.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a generic input error occurs with ObjectInputStream
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the serialised class is not found when reading back

      • setN

        void setN(int n)
        Sets the number of rows for the grid.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of rows

      • setM

        void setM(int m)
        Sets the number of columns for the grid.
        Parameters:
        m - the number of columns

      • setNumPlayers

        void setNumPlayers(int numPlayers)
        Sets the number of players selected.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - the number of players

      • turnOnKeyboardMode

        private void turnOnKeyboardMode()
        Turns on the keyboard mode so that the game can be played using the keyboard as well and not just the mouse.

      • turnOffKeyboardMode

        private void turnOffKeyboardMode()
        Turns off the keyboard mode so that the game cannot be influenced by the keyboard. Only the mouse can be used to play the game in this case.

      • setBorderPaneProperties

        private void setBorderPaneProperties()
        Adds event handlers to the BorderPane that will be used to toggle keyboard mode.

      • start

        void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        The main function for the game page that initialises the required properties for the game to start, builds the visual components, and displays once completed.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - is the Stage on which the visuals will be shown
